description:
The opening for this position is rolling (until the right fit is found), or until March 25th.

The Video Consortium, a global media organization that supports and connects today’s documentary filmmakers and visual journalists, is seeking its first Director of Strategic Partnerships to join the team. In this exciting new role, the Director of Strategic Partnerships will build and implement the organization’s foundational strategies around corporate sponsorships, business partnerships, and individual donor campaigns.

This person must come to VC with feet already deep in business development: with existing corporate relationships in their back pockets and a passionate, charismatic knack for “the art of the sale.” They will be joining a fully remote and small yet extremely spirited core staff that runs the organization; they must be ready and excited to be part of a fast-paced and collaborative start-up environment. The right candidate has the opportunity to build this essential role from the ground up, all the while working alongside an inspiring and talented global community of storytellers who are pushing to catalyze social change.

Responsibilities:

Business Development + Corporate Sponsorships:
• Develop marketing materials and strategies for VC as a whole
• Deepen relationships with VC’s existing partners and nurture new ones
• Outreach and incubate new partnerships and corporate sponsorships that align with VC’s mission, vision, and values
• Coordinate with VC staff to implement partnership deliverables
• Work with the Executive Director to identify and execute new development opportunities that benefit VC’s creative community

Individual Donor Cultivation
• Help oversee VC’s major donor strategy, from directing related marketing communications to cultivating relationships with existing and, especially, new major donors
• Manage event-focused community and donor activations (one-offs, at industry events/festivals) and envision innovative pathways to build upon already existing events.

Qualifications:
• Minimum of 4 years of experience in business development/sales
• A robust or growing rolodex of existing relationships with media-driven companies, and beyond
• A proven ability to tell the story of a brand with confidence and charisma
• Meticulous and nuanced written and oral communication skills
• Excellent project management skills and extreme organizational abilities
• A gift for pleasant persistence
• A track record of innovation and successful sales/business development growth in previous positions
• A deep passion for serving a greater purpose and a drive to contribute to and build infrastructure that supports a noble mission for decades to come.

Role Specifics:
• Reports to the Executive Director
• Full-time (W2)
• Salary: $70,000 to $74,000, based on experience
• Fully remote and flexible work hours
• We offer healthcare and home office stipends, as well as generous PTO and holiday schedules.

Please apply with:
• Your resume / Linkedin
• A cover letter specifically addressing previous sales experience and where you’re looking to go in your career
• 5+ examples of partnerships made, sales landed, etc from past roles

We look forward to learning about you and your work!
